sentences.sContent: Just like this California condor, which—though teetering on the edge of extinction—still soars near the Grand Canyon in Arizona and in the state it was named after.
sentences.sContent_eng: Just like this California condor, which—though teetering on the edge of extinction—still soars near the Grand Canyon in Arizona and in the state it was named after.
sentences.sCn: 就像加利福利亚秃鹫，虽然依旧翱翔于亚利桑那和加利福利亚的大峡谷附近，但已在灭绝的悬崖边摇摇欲坠。

sentences.sContent: An Andean condor fliesover the Colca canyon at the Colca valley in Arequipa, south of Lima, on January 30, 2011.
sentences.sContent_eng: An Andean condor fliesover the Colca canyon at the Colca valley in Arequipa, south of Lima, on January 30, 2011.
sentences.sCn: 2011年1月30日，利马南部城市阿雷基帕的科尔卡大峡谷，一直安第斯秃鹰正在展翅飞翔。

sentences.sContent: One example is the California condor.
sentences.sCn: 有一个加利福尼亚秃鹫的例子。

trans.tranOther: a very large South American  vulture (= a bird that eats dead animals )
